snippet.title: Plebiscite would boost MP vote: Senator
snippet.content: A bill on same-sex marriage would have a better chance of passing parliament if a plebiscite is passed, a key crossbench senator says. Liberal Democrats senator David Leyonhjelm says advocates of the marriage law change should consider the numbers in parliament before dismissing the idea of a national vote on the issue. "I am not at all confident it will get through parliament on a free vote, whereas I am totally confident it will be accepted (by parliament) after a plebiscite," Senator Leyonhjelm told Sky News on Monday. (C) AAP 2017
